chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine D Buchanon

defendant.name: Buchanon, Antoine D
defendant.address: 115 W Doty St, c/o Dane County Jail, Madison, WI 53703

records.addlTxt: Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 9/19/22 sent electronically to DCJ and DOC.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Antoine D Buchanon in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Antoine D Buchanon.  Attorney Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties agree to dismiss and read in counts 1, 2, and 3.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:20 PM Defendant Antoine D Buchanon in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Antoine D Buchanon.  Attorney Cecelia DeMarco for Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. Argument by Atty Franks - requests bail to be amended to signature bond. Argument by ADA DeMarco. CT denies DE motion to modify bail.  Bail cont'd.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

2:58 PM Defendant Antoine D Buchanon in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Antoine D Buchanon.  Attorney Cecelia DeMarco for Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. Det. D Swanson, MAPD, duly sworn & testified. Direct exam by ADA DeMarco. Witness ID'd DE. Cross by Atty Frank. Witness excused. No further witnesses. Atty Frank request court take judicial notice of criminal complaint in 22CF1736. Objection by ADA. CT takes judicial notice of 22CF1736. ADA moves for bindover, reserves argument. Argument by Atty Frank. Argument by ADA DeMarco. CT finds probable cause & grants bindover.
Bail/bond hearing on August 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Antoine D Buchanon
Current: 115 W Doty St, c/o Dane County Jail, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 07-29-2022)
Prior: 407 Pawling St, Madison, WI 53704
to reschedule 08-02-2022 preliminary hearing and re-address bond - GRANTED
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Hannah L. 
- Defendant shall not be on Willard St in Madison. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

01:40 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Allegra L Berry.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim via Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
